title: Head-on Shrimp In Tomato Chervil Broth
summary: Head-on Shrimp In Tomato Chervil Broth is a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal recipe with 4 servings. One serving contains 333 calories, 51g of protein, and 4g of fat. For $5.42 per serving, this recipe covers 33% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. If you have canned tomatoes, garlic clove, head-on shrimp, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the kosher salt you could follow this main course with the Low Fat Crumbs Cake (Kosher-Dairy) as a dessert. It works well as an expensive main course. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 36 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 73%. This score is pretty good. Try Lion’s Head Meatballs in Broth, Shrimp and Fingerlings in Tomato Broth, and Mussels and Shrimp in Spicy Tomato Broth for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp works really well with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. The St. Michael-Eppan Anger Pinot Grigio with a 4.3 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 23 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: St. Michael-Eppan Anger Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Depending on the soil and microclimate, Pinot gris varies from a simple everyday wine all the way up to absolute top growths. The warm, sun-exposed vineyards of the Anger sites, with their loamy limestone gravel soils, are a textbook example. The Anger Alto Adige Pinot Grigio has a noble structure, nice balance and fine acidity – making it an absolute pleasure to drink. The strong white goes well with fish and fish soup, guinea fowl breast or veal fillet.
